data.sampled:
0.</s> 
Can you provide additional information on the specific medical signals or relevant factors that would be helpful in predicting heart disease and generating a more accurate prediction?</s> 
The medical signals and relevant factors would depend on the specific patient's medical history, symptoms, and test results. Some examples of possible factors to consider include family history of heart disease, smoking, high blood pressure, diabetes, obesity, physical activity level, and medications or treatments the patient is currently undergoing. It may also be helpful to consider the patient's age and gender, as heart disease tends to occur more commonly in men after the age of 45 and in women after the age of 55. Additional information such as coronary artery calcification score, blood calcium levels, and inflammatory markers may also be helpful in predicting heart disease risk.
